stork.feather.util

Class BellLoop

  • java.lang.Object
    • stork.feather.Bell
      • stork.feather.util.BellLoop
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Future

    public abstract class BellLoop
extends Bell
    An experimental Bell-driven loop.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BellLoop

        public BellLoop()
        Create a BellLoop synchronized on itself.

      • BellLoop

        public BellLoop(Object lock)
        Create a BellLoop synchronized on lock. Everytime looping is done, the lock will be synchronized on.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Start looping immediately.

      • start

        public void start(Bell bell)
        Start looping when bell rings. If bell is null, start immediately.

      • then

        protected final void then(Object o)
        When a Bell this BellLoop is promised to rings, start the loop.
        Overrides:
        then in class Bell
        Parameters:
        o - the value of the parent Bell.

      • lock

        public abstract Bell lock()
        Return a Bell that will ring when the next iteration of the loop should run. If null is returned, the body executes immediately.

      • condition

        public boolean condition()
        Return true as long as the loop should run.

      • body

        public abstract void body()
                   throws Exception
        The iteration operation performed by the loop. This method should return a Bell that will ring when the next iteration should be performed. This method may stop the loop by ringing the BellLoop. Otherwise, the loop will be stopped when condition() is false.
        Throws:
        Exception
